key_sentences: And I said, Lord, how shall this be?
But what shall I now do to you?
When they go out, he shall go out.
You shall not do so to Yahweh your God.
Shall we do what he says?

[0 3]: You shall eat, and not be satisfied.
Therefore the peoples shall give you thanks forever and ever.
If you° be born, you° shall be born to a curse; If you° die, a curse shall be your portion.
[1 3]: It shall come to pass on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.” Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, “At evening, you shall know that Yahweh has brought you out from the land of Egypt.
Speak to them, saying, ‘At evening you shall eat meat, and in the morning you shall be filled with bread.
Today you shall not find it in the field.
[2 3]: I will take you, and you shall reign according to all that your soul desires, and shall be king over Israel.
They shall enter into the king’s palace.
Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in justice.
[3 4]: David inquired again of God; and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them.
When David inquired of Yahweh, he said, “You shall not go up.

Nevertheless, you shall not build the house; but your son who shall come out of your body, he shall build the house for my name.’ Yahweh has established his word that he spoke; for I have risen up in the place of David my father, and I sit on the throne of Israel, as Yahweh promised, and have built the house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.
[3 5]: I take to witness the grace of the people that shall come, whose little ones rejoice with gladness: and though they see me not with bodily eyes, yet in spirit they shall believe the thing that I say.
What then shall we say about these things?
“ ‘Each one of you shall respect his mother and his father.
